Review:
I adore this face oil. Me: SUPER oily, scar easily, the second it seems like the existing cystic acne FINALLY starts disappearing, theres another few ready to take their place somewhere else, I wear light makeup because its not for me but im ashamed of my skin. I can't say I remember where I heard of this oil, but I decided to get a sample of it soon after I heard of it. The first two nights I washed my face, used a toner, slathered on a serum, a treatment and finished with this. I woke up both mornings feeling greasy. I decided on the next evening to give this a more honest try. So I washed my face, used a toner and used this oil. The next morning was skin was beautiful. **MY** skin was beautiful. I have struggled with cystic acne and textured skin and scars-- and I woke up with the cystic acne receding (not as large or painful) and despite the scars, my skin was smooth and healthy looking. Ive been using this over the last almost 2 weeks and (I only use at night) my days are super long -- 10-13 hours long depending on the day. Ill come home and remove my makeup and have one or two painful bumps developing beneath my skin. Ill do my aforementioned nightly routine and within a few hours, the painful bump is less painful, less pronounced/inflamed. My scars: I don't think this is an oil dedicated to reducing scar appearance, but over the time Ive been using this product with my simple routine, scars that should have lasted WAY longer and become WAY darker (because I have the awful habit of picking during high anxiety), are fading pretty darn fast in comparison to what Im accustom. I am completely in love with this oil. Im excited to see what else I can use from this line during the day and with makeup!

User:
kelllllyyyyy
Eye Color Hazel
Hair color Blonde
Skin Tone Fair
Skin Type Dry
Review:
One great thing about this cream is that when I’m cleansing my face about 12-ish hours later, it’s still on my skin. Think about how your face feels immediately after your skincare routine. Smooth, bouncy, Soft? how long does that look and feel really last? It varies by weather, season, how dry oily or balanced your skin is individually doing .. but more than any moisturizer I can recall, this really works and lasts as that final, occlusive step. It is the end result of a small army of skincare potions, but with this moisturizer that bouncy look and petal-soft feel stays all day. I can’t say that about products twice the cost or twice as thick. I guess I’m being impossible, bc that’s also what’s wrong with this cream. If you are even leaning toward an oily skin day, this is going to make it worse. And as for wearing with makeup, I like a very dewy look, layering glossy-finish creams and opalescent primers, but they don’t melt into the skin on top of this. It’s one or the other, this cream with a simple bb, or skip it and use my ‘glass skin’ products. As for the claims of being youth activating and neurotransmitting (or something) I’m not going to tell you I look five years younger after going through a jar. I will say I’m happy with my skin, and this cream’s effects are better than most. Verdict? Better at night than day, winter than summer, dry than oily. Lasts an unusually long time, which is big selling point for very dry types and those who carry a mist at all times. Personally I have already switched to something different for the day, now that it’s summer, and am moving on to something new for night. Might buy again though. Good value btw. Most creams with this sophisticated texture and formulation are far more expensive.

User:
Anglage
Skin Tone Fair
Skin Type Combination
Review:
I am now on my second container of the Essential Energy Moisturizing Cream and I have to say, this is now my favourite daily moisturizer. Efficacy: I have mild acne and combination skin. This cream absorbed well on my face and kept it moisturized. It even calmed down the redness from acne and the effect was overnight. This was probably my greatest surprise. Texture: I have tried the Benefiance Wrinkle Smoothing Cream (more gel-like than cream) and the Essential Energy Moisturizing Gel Cream. Both of these products resulted in a persistent patchy shine and stickiness. This cream went on matte and does not turn shiny. My skin feels smooth and it does not feel like a heavy layer of film is on the surface. Ingredients: I wanted something without parabens and mineral oil. This checks the box. The only thing that may be a deal breaker for others is the clean floral fragrance. I find it pleasant, light, and not long lasting. However if you have a sensitivity to fragrance, this might not be for you. Most of Shiseido's products contain fragrance, so this is worth noting. Packaging: I think some people may find the packaging unnecessarily large relative to the amount of product. However, I like the way it sits in the hand. If I had to be critical, I would say that compared to the Benefiance line, it would be nice to see glass jars instead of plastic. Overall: This moisturizer checks all the boxes for me. I would happily repurchase this and I hope it stays in the product line for many years to come.

Review:
Ok, I don’t know what this magical potion of hydration and calm is, but you need it in your life. I’m currently pregnant, and my skin has become extremely dry and sensitive. I started getting all these little colorless bumps on my forehead, which my OB said were clogged pores due to hormonal changes, and I’ve tried SO many things without success to get rid of them. YTTP interested me because they’re a more natural, clean brand. I started out with their adaptogen moisture face cream, and that helped a lot with the dryness and redness, but I still felt like I needed more. After reading reviews on how well this adaptogen spray compliments the moisturizer, I decided to give it a try. THE LITTLE BUMPS ON MY FOREHEAD ARE ALL GONE!! I’m literally in shock. This spray is the only thing I’ve changed in my routine in weeks, and within 2 days my face is better than ever. I’ve never been confident going without foundation or BB cream, and this spray paired with the adaptogen moisturizer has made my skin look and feel calm, hydrated, and glowy. The acne like bumps are gone, my redness is pretty much gone, and I’ve never had such flawless looking skin in my life. And the mist is so, so refreshing, it truly feels like heaven spritzing it on your face. If you’re like me, I’m skeptical of reviews where people received a free product, because I’m worried they’re not as honest. Well, I didn’t receive this product for free, I paid full price, and I’m still raving about it because it’s just THAT GOOD. I never knew one product alone could make such an amazing world of difference, and I’m in love.

Review:
I bought this product to use as my daily moisturizer in the morning. I have combination skin; a very oily t-zone and dry cheeks. I do NOT wear foundation during the week. A little bit goes a long way with this product. It goes on very thick and makes my skin look super greasy at first (probably because of the SPF) but I've found that after about 15-20 minutes, it absorbs a bit and does not feel as heavy or oily. Because my cheeks are dry, I usually start my application there and then work it through to the rest of my face. I actually feel like this moisturizer makes my skin less oily than most daily moisturizers I've tried with NO SPF. (I'm pushing 30 so, SPF is important to me at this point.) I did wear this under a full face of makeup this weekend and did not feel that it contributed to any accelerated or additional creasing, etc. All-in-all it's a good daily moisturizer but again - don't overdo it especially if you do have oily skin.

User:
kelloggs75
Eye Color Brown
Hair color Brunette
Skin Tone Fair
Skin Type Combination
Review:
This is a great moisturizer for either day or nighttime use depending on the season and/or how dry your skin is. My skin is oily-combination and I find that this cream can be a bit too heavy and oily if I apply too much but a thin layer leaves a nice, glowy finish that still feels hydrating. It provides the perfect base for makeup and/or SPF and does not pill or interfere with the texture of the products being applied over it in any way. Another thing that I really like about this moisturizer (and the whole range of face creams) is that the finish remains exactly the same and does not become more dry or oily throughout the day, which is a major plus. The only reason I’m not giving this 5-stars is that while it feels very smooth and hydrating on and does its job as a moisturizer very well, I don’t feel like it does anything to actually improve the quality my skin whether it be anti-aging, redness or texture. For the price, I definitely expected more in terms of skin benefits/improvements. That said, it is the only moisturizer I’ve tried that a) maintains the same finish throughout the day and b) works perfectly under makeup and other products. I have used other creams that had more of an impact in terms of improving my skin/addressing a specific concerns but there was always a trade-off in terms of finish (i.e., too shiny) and/or compatibility with other products, so for that reason, I’ve been using the Sturm face creams as moisturizers exclusively for months (and have already repurchased) while relying on other products to target specific skin concerns. So if you are looking for a moisturizer that will actually improve your skin, this might be disappointing. But if you are already have a routine full off various treatments/serums and are just looking for something that will provide hydration, maintain its finish throughout the day and wear well under makeup, this is a solid choice.

Another reason I love it is because it gives your skin a bit of a glow/dew which I kind of have been more into lately. Last thing that’s great about this is that it can actually double as a primer, idk what it is but it’s so hydrating I guess that foundation looks great on top of it. If I do ever put this on and feel like my skin has a little too much dew before my foundation I’ll just blot with a tissue before applying my foundation. I adore this. Eye Color Brown

Review:
I'm no stranger to retinol, but I had not used the ingredient for over a year. I was worried about being sensitive to it again, so I bought this product. I experienced no irritation, break outs, or peeling. This product delivers retinol results without the irritation. However, the seams on the end of my tube began to open a few days ago. I don't know why this is. Perhaps the adhesive that is meant to keep it together isn't strong enough, but that's a definite downside to the product, and for $55 I expect better. Retinol breaks down when routinely exposed to air. It's not harmful, but it does become less effective. Maybe I was just unlucky, but I think this is something people should be aware of. If it wasn’t for that issue, I’d give the product 5 stars otherwise.

Review:
I love it! I recently decided to make a switch to using primarily oil cleansers, and had to spend so much time looking for one that doesn't contain a plethora of unnecessary and/or negative ingredients that I was almost tempted to just diy it (wouldn't have ended well, that much is sure). Thankfully, I finally found this one, and I would definitely recommend this cleanser over most other brands' oil cleansers. The four main oils this includes in its ingredients are all relatively low on the comedogenic scale, which, nice. It does have added fragrance, which is unfortunate, but otherwise fits all my wants. I don't wear a lot of makeup, but what I do wear (a little concealer, eyeshadow) it melts off perfectly. On days when I don't wear makeup I just use this on its own. Two to three pumps dispenses just the right amount of product. It leaves my skin feeling clean and soft, and with none of the tight, dry sensation you might get from many foaming cleansers. I have combination skin with easily clogged pores, especially on my forehead, and so far this hasn't broken me out from daily use. I'm very happy with this product.

User:
Nakali
Eye Color Green
Hair color Brunette
Skin Tone Olive
Skin Type Combination
Review:
I got lucky. I choose this as a 100 point prize on a whim just because I needed some moisturizer. I was Blown away. Im not sure how this will behave on oily skin, but if you have combo skin or dry skin I would definitely reccomend. For The record, I currently have dehydrated skin which is different then dry skin. Dehydrated skin gets oily on the outside because your skin is trying to overcompensate for being so dry, but underneath the layer of oil is dry flaky skin. Most likely from not eating/drinking properly in my case. A few minutes after applying this moisturizer , I could tell it was high quality. Usually facial moisturizers temporarily moisturize the outside of my skin and then evaporate. However, This moisturizer really penetrated ALL the layers of my skin. My skin felt smooth and supple from the inside out. I wore as a base before my primer then applied liquid foundation. This really helps lock in moisture. This was in the spring so I can’t imagine how great this product would be in the winter! I normally have to touch up around lunch time. Wiping my whole face away and starting from scratch because I get dry flakes or my makeup either starts caking or sliding or a combination of both. (Ugh) I did not have to touch up once when I wear this. Makeup will never be perfect all day, but this was close. I wore as a base, then applied Smashbox primer, then a mix of bb cream and liquid foundation. I’m not sure if it was this alone or if these products were a magic combo, but my skin looked so glowy healthy and nice when I wore this. My skin was mosturized and stayed hydrated for many hours. I emphasize HYDRATED NOT GREASY. This was my first experience with this brand and a pleasant one. I hope to experiment and buy a few more of their products to enjoy.
…read more

Exorbitant price: No matter how I put it, SK-II LXP is way too expensive for a middle class salary. A jar might last up to 3 , may be 4 months if used sparingly. User:
rebec39
Received free product
Age 35-44
Skin Type Normal
Review:
I'm going to give SK-II LXP Ultimate Revival Cream five stars after I've been using it twice daily for about three weeks. This is a very thick cream, so be warned about this ahead of time! If you just need light moisture, you may not enjoy the drenching this cream does to your skin! I only recently started to feel like I was starting to get saggy in certain spots, so I feel like I am late to the anti-wrinkle game. However, I know a good beauty product when I try one, and this is one of them! The cream is very thick, so much so that you will be ahead of the game if you put a small amount in your palm and allow it to melt a little from your body heat before applying to your face. This is one of those products that seems to have several functions covered in one step. It is a moisturizer that truly will keep your face plump with moisture even longer than the promised 12 hours, it has great anti-wrinkle ingredients that go to work while you wear it, and it does a fantastic job of filling in fine lines (because it's so hydrating or because of the ingredients or both - I have no idea!) This cream leaves your skin very soft and, once the cream is absorbed, silky smooth. I find that it serves as a great base for other makeup items, such as bronzer and blush. No need for a primer! And this smells absolutely amazing, so despite all of the chemical-sounding ingredients, you smell roses on your face!!!! I really like this cream and will be continuing to use this as my day and night cream from now on. The name says it all - this revives tired, dry skin! Thank you to SK-II for the opportunity to try this cream!

User: Binreddy
Review:
I recently received this product as part of a promotion and was very interested/excited about trying it out. I have been looking for a really good moisturizer for a while now. I wanted to use this for awhile so I can give an honest review of this product. I have to say right off the back, the packaging is so beautiful. Although most of my cosmetics/facial care products are usually hidden away in my drawers/medicine cabinet, this product has found a home right next to the toothbrush and face cleaner, "very counter space-worthy". But the main question remains, does it work? Does it do all it claims to do? In a nutshell, it does. One negative is that it doesn't come with clear instructions, so I had to look up exactly how to use it and how much to use and what exactly is that stick thing? Which by the way is an stick/spatula to use while applying said product, so that you don't have to stick your fingers in it.which I very much appreciate. A plus for those germaphobes out there. But clearer instructions would be very helpful. As for the product itself, I didn't really pick up that rose scent that it claims to have, but that is fine. I tend to prefer products without too much of a scent. It is very thick and creamy. I was worried that it would be very heavy and leave my skin feeling very oily. But since you only need a pearl sized amount, it is just enough to give your skin the moisture it needs without leaving your skin feeling like you just washed it in a vat of oil. And the moisture does last and there is no need to reapply. I have been using it as part of my nightly skin care routine and I have found that the size my pores have diminished and that my skin no longer has that tight and dry feeling it tends to get. The skin as whole feels firmer, as well. Although they recommend using it morning and night, I only use at night because I prefer a lighter moisturizer during the day. The main negative is the price. I have very mixed feelings, about this product. On one hand, I do love the results but I don't think I can really spend nor justify spending a couple hundred dollars on just one product.

I'm Asian, and in many Asian countries, SK-II is considered the queen of skin care. I've used many of their products, and all of them have performed beyond my expectation. However, after using this cream for the past 4 weeks, I can truly say this is the most luxurious cream I've ever used. I have very sensitive rosacea skin and I usually steer away from scented products, but this SK-II Ultimate Revival Cream has the most beautiful and genuine rose scent in skin care products. It's light and it doesn't irritate my skin at all. This facial cream also seems to balance my skin as well, no more dry patches and oily T-zone. My whole face is moisturized but not greasy, and it works wonderfully under my full face of makeup. I use it day and night but a little goes a long way, so this jar should last you a while. Many people have noticed my skin tone being more even, and this is the only new product I added to my skin care routine recently, so I know it's working. I just turned 30 and have no visible fine lines yet so I can't comment on the effect of anti-aging, but I find my skin looking energized and soft, which does make my skin look more youthful. I'd definitely repurchase and would recommend SK-II Ultimate Revival Cream to every one that wants to pamper their skin. It's truly a treat to use this facial cream. *I received this product from SK-II in exchange for my honest opinion."

Review:
This has been a god send! I apologize in advance for the lengthy review, but if it helps just one other person, then it was well worth it! After suffering with contact dermatitis on my lips for the last year and a half (to which me and my dermatologist still cannot figure out), this salve gives me much needed relief! I have changed my entire skincare routine, stopped wearing lipstick/lipgloss, switched to hypoallergenic toothpaste, I've even gone so far as to stop using the water from my sink and stopped kissing my pet parrot thinking that one of those things may be the culprit; alas, to no avail. I have tried multiple prescriptions and steroid creams that sting, make my lips peel off in sheets, or make them feel like leather, and I had had enough. I wanted to find something healthier and more homeopathic, and this is it! I will admit that I still have trouble with flare ups on the boarders of my lips, but using this in combination with their Lip Savior (not sold at sephora- you have to buy it from the skinfix websitee) have made my lips FINALLY feel like soft, supple lips again! As soon as I feel a flare up coming, I dab a little of this on, and it takes it away within minutes. I am so thankful and relieved to have found this line. I even bought the barrier lip gloss to use in between my flare ups, and I love that product too!
